subject: Photography
title: Golden Hour and Blue Hour
description: A fast breakdown of Golden Hour and Blue Hour for builders.

hook.text: Photographers worship two brief windows: the golden hour and the blue hour. Both are about color temperature.

buildup.text: Golden hour occurs just after sunrise and before sunset. Warm, directional light paints everything in amber.

discovery.text: Blue hour follows sunset. The sky turns deep blue while city lights glow warm ‚Äî a natural complementary palette.

twist.text: Despite the name, neither lasts a full hour. Near the equator, they can be as short as twenty minutes.

climax.text: These windows offer the best natural light because the sun's angle creates long shadows, warm tones, and soft contrast.

punchline.text: The best light is free. But it only lasts minutes.

quiz.question: Why is golden hour light prized by photographers?
options: It creates warm tones, long shadows, and soft contrast
It's the brightest time of day
Cameras work better during golden hour
